Encapsulations for In-band OAM Data Encapsulations for In-band OAM Data
draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-00 draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-01
Abstract Abstract
In-band operation, administration and maintenance (OAM) records In-band operation, administration and maintenance (OAM) records
operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet
traverses a path between two points in the network. In-band OAM is traverses a path between two points in the network. In-band OAM is
to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or
other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-band OAM other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-band OAM
data records can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment data records can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment
Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension header), and IPv4. Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension header), and IPv4.
